update.description:
Enables an option to disable the dynamics of the sandia hands, so they are just stumps with fixed joints. Cameras are still enabled. This significantly improves real-time performance. This option has been added to quals 1 and 3, and vrc task 2.

To test, build [sandia-hand branch stumps_drcsim](#!/osrf/sandia-hand/compare/stumps_drcsim..default#diff) from source, then build drcsim.

Two arguments are required:

* hand_suffix:=_stumps
* gzworld:=*_task_n_stumps.world
~~~
roslaunch atlas_utils qual_task_1.launch gzworld:=qual_task_1_stumps.world hand_suffix:=_stumps

roslaunch atlas_utils qual_task_3.launch gzworld:=qual_task_3_stumps.world hand_suffix:=_stumps

roslaunch atlas_utils vrc_task_2.launch gzworld:=vrc_task_2_stumps.world hand_suffix:=_stumps
~~~

This pull request requires simultaneous release with sandia-hand.

UPDATE: update SandiaHandPlugin to retain publishers / subscribers
update.title: Sandia Hand stumps -- wait to merge this

pullrequest.title: Sandia Hand stumps -- wait to merge this

content.raw:
I just updated the pull request to retain the Publish/Subscribes with two caveats, which I think are minor.

1. Normally, the full scoped names of the joints are published in the joint_states messages. However, since those joints don't exist, only unscoped names are published.  [See SandiaHandPlugin:156-157](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/df3e133572b44f7932981e1f22b65e38f9d47641/ros/atlas_msgs/SandiaHandPlugin.cpp?at=sandia_hand_stumps#cl-156)

2. The thumb angle is moved away from the default position to avoid obstructing the cameras. Its joint angles are still reported as zeros, which is a slight mismatch from normal behavior.
content.html:
I just updated the pull request to retain the Publish/Subscribes with two caveats, which I think are minor.

  1. Normally, the full scoped names of the joints are published in the joint_states messages. However, since those joints don't exist, only unscoped names are published. See SandiaHandPlugin:156-157

  2. The thumb angle is moved away from the default position to avoid obstructing the cameras. Its joint angles are still reported as zeros, which is a slight mismatch from normal behavior.

content.raw:
We'd be keen on this. Its awkward to switch between having hands and no hands on our robot models.

Will this publish sandia_hand/joint_angles (with static values)?
